tweet:
Wishing a Happy Mother’s Day to my amazing mom, my wife Jodi, and all the moms out there! Thank you for all that you do!

For many, this Mothers Day might look a little different. My thoughts are with the moms who are spending this special day away from their families this year. https://t.co/mHoyF1vUDp
Happy Fishing Opener, Minnesota! I’m happy to be out on the lake with my family and I hope you all have a chance to do the same! https://t.co/XaJnYjyWAZ

On the 75th anniversary of VE Day, let us remember the members of the Greatest Generation who bravely answered the call to serve and fought to protect the many freedoms we enjoy today. https://t.co/5Y4NgK3vpz

On this National Day of Prayer, I join with Minnesotans and many across this nation in praying for those who are struggling amid the COVID-19 crisis. We will get through this together. https://t.co/tnZogugM43

I'm incredibly excited to hear that @3M is partnering with the @DeptofDefense to boost N95 mask production! This is a great step towards ensuring a sustainable supply chain and resupplying the Strategic National Stockpile. More info here: https://t.co/2OpA7YWHMr
Thanks for having me! Small businesses are the backbone of our economy so I will continue to help them weather this pandemic. https://t.co/FHUdmoz9w0

Today, I joined @EPAAWheeler in announcing a Brownfield Grant worth $600,000 for #MN08. This is exciting news as these funds will be used to transform contaminated sites into community assets, helping to unleash the economic engine. Learn more: https://t.co/W3KHcPqAxX

COVID-19 has exposed the dangers of reliance on China for the medications so many Americans depend on. That’s why I introduced legislation to require federal agencies to purchase drugs made in the USA & reduce dependence on nations like China. Learn more: https://t.co/JJiabM5s87 https://t.co/dqemNzupZ6

May is National Teacher Appreciation Month, so I want to thank all of Minnesota's educators for their unwavering commitment to our students, especially now during a time of remote teaching and virtual learning. https://t.co/q9HzuwkXPW

Millions of Minnesotans have already received their Economic Impact Payments from the IRS to help mitigate the effects of COVID-19.

Thanks to the 4,200 Minnesotans who joined my telephone town hall last night! I appreciated the productive discussion.

COVID-19 has had a devastating effect on Minnesota workers. DOL has awarded over $9.8 million in emergency unemployment grants to help mitigate those effects.
 
In addition, I voted for legislation that expanded paid sick, family, and medical leave during this crisis. https://t.co/MsQichQbYa

The PPP has served as a critical lifeline for small businesses. The first round of PPP funding allocated $9 billion to over 46,000 small businesses in Minnesota.
 
Last week, I voted to replenish the PPP with $310 billion in funding. For more info visit https://t.co/bqaG9wqsUs. https://t.co/mPmo7SFMH0

COVID-19 has highlighted the deficiency of our supply chain & made clear the need to domestically source critical minerals used in every sector. Today, I introduced a bill to help build a supply chain that is mined and manufactured in America!

Learn more: https://t.co/25ueaxzz72 https://t.co/0o5cD8xFjf
Following the passage of the CARES Act, the Department of Housing and Urban Development allocated over $53 million to assist Minnesota’s vulnerable families. https://t.co/28TDUO7esF

As we continue to fight the coronavirus, I believe we must also begin to responsibly map a path back to economic prosperity.

Check out my full op-ed here: https://t.co/PTMQCHt1Aa

Yesterday, the House passed the Paycheck Protection and Health Care Enhancement Act to help more of Minnesota's small business owners and employees weather the COVID-19 pandemic. Check out my full statement: https://t.co/xv4Le0sBK8

The Trump Admin. is coordinating Project Air Bridge to help get critical medical supplies into the US from other countries.

Happy Earth Day everyone!

April is Child Abuse Prevention Month, and across the nation, states are reporting fewer calls to child abuse hotlines. Sadly, this is not because there are fewer cases of abuse, but because fewer cases are being reported amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
